TopicTitle: [0.25] Lionhead Aerospace Inc. - Icarus v0.4 updated

Articles.Content:
Got to say yogui, I love all of your mods, and I'm really happy the DSL has been updated my Atlas now has a purpose

Anywho, I was wondering what scale your parts are in relation to real life? I tried putting the prometheus rover on the Delta II, but either prometheus was a bit too big, or the Delta II was too small, but it didn't fit. DSL fits inside my Atlas 5m fairings, just, although it has a tendency to blow up either a fairing, the heatsheild, or both

Anyway, great work on everything

Yes, thanks to Lionhead community to reach 100 pages milestone:

About airbags: Making a larger nacelle is easily doable I think, just need a few modification. I could have a look to make airbags that could be attached anywhere, it may be a little harder to make something work properly but I could try.

That would be so awesome if you could
When are we going to get the Icarus interplanetary ship? I don't want to be nasty but PLLEEEASEE my kerbals are very sad they want to fly it and crash it

Got to say yogui, I love all of your mods, and I'm really happy the DSL has been updated my Atlas now has a purpose

Anywho, I was wondering what scale your parts are in relation to real life? I tried putting the prometheus rover on the Delta II, but either prometheus was a bit too big, or the Delta II was too small, but it didn't fit. DSL fits inside my Atlas 5m fairings, just, although it has a tendency to blow up either a fairing, the heatsheild, or both

Anyway, great work on everything

Regarding the Prometheus, wait for an update, it'll have a proper capsule. The Thor needs to be scaled down a bit (there's a list somewhere in this thread), the DSL needs to be scaled down by a factor of 0.7.
Okay so I don't know if this is because Im on a mac but for some reason the DSL sky crane does not appear in my game even though it is installed. Can someone help?

Okay so I don't know if this is because Im on a mac but for some reason the DSL sky crane does not appear in my game even though it is installed. Can someone help?

You may not have downloaded the required plugins. Check the Instructions file in the archive for links.

I have a problem with the mod dsl pandora Release 21.1 ksp, basically I installed all the plugins required and the mod itself (in the folder "GameData") but I can see some parts (in the sense that they do not appear in your menu selection ), such as the mast, or the forearm etc..

In short, although the files of the parts are present, I do not see "arms" of the rover.

How can I fix?

Have you download and install correctly the plugins (check Instruction file in the archive for links).

What is your error? Can you post a screenshot?

Yogui,

The primary problem that I can see with the MEM is that it is currently missing the model.mu files that are supposed to be there so there is no shape for the Lander itself. The command module works perfectly fine just the Landers pod is missing the models.

Yogui,

The primary problem that I can see with the MEM is that it is currently missing the model.mu files that are supposed to be there so there is no shape for the Lander itself. The command module works perfectly fine just the Landers pod is missing the models.

I agree with this. The MEM+CSM.craft can not be loaded in the VAB due to the model.mu file missing from the MemPod folder.

I have a problem with the mod dsl pandora Release 21.1 ksp, basically I installed all the plugins required and the mod itself (in the folder "GameData") but I can see some parts (in the sense that they do not appear in your menu selection ), such as the mast, or the forearm etc..

In short, although the files of the parts are present, I do not see "arms" of the rover.

How can I fix?

You seem to have an issue with MuMecjJeb plugin. Make sure you correctly download and install it. Use the link in the archive.

Yogui,

The primary problem that I can see with the MEM is that it is currently missing the model.mu files that are supposed to be there so there is no shape for the Lander itself. The command module works perfectly fine just the Landers pod is missing the models.

You're right, I don't know why this file is missing.

Due to a low internet, I can't update it on Spaceport so for now this is a mirror link for the missing model.mu: http://www./?amda17httnnn11y

You're right, I don't know why this file is missing.

Due to a low internet, I can't update it on Spaceport so for now this is a mirror link for the missing model.mu: http://www./?amda17httnnn11y

Thank you! This allows the MEM+CSM.craft to load properly.
I just remembered that you're doing the Cupola, Yogui. What's the status on that? I can help with testing if you want.
I've got difficulties to make interior works correctly. 3D meshes are done, I need to have a look at it again. Right now it's summer and I spend less time in front of my computer.

I'd like to say thanks for these great mods. I am new to KSP, but find these mods to be of great quality and enjoy using them for many Kerbal Launches.

I have a few questions about your Vega platform:

Do you intend to add RCS and control capabilities to the AVUM module?

Any plans for the VESPA multi payload module for it?

Thanks,

Cowboy_WY

Alright, That makes sense why it does not work. I will download 1.9.8 thanks! =)
Can you tell when it will support the current MJ version?

I just downloaded the CSM-MEM pack the other day. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a beautiful lander, but has anyone realized that you can fly the MEM to the MÃƒÂ¼n all by itself and have enough Delta-V to return?

You might need to slap a solar panel and a parachute on it to survive the trip, but seriously, you can put the MEM by itself on the KSC launch pad, lift off and fly to the MÃƒÂ¼n, land, take off (with the descent stage, no need to leave all that remaining fuel behind!) and have enough fuel to return to land on Kerbin.

So maybe a bit unbalanced Ã¢â‚¬â€œ but still beautiful and fun.

This is off topic according to this thread, but i know you have helped with flags. I tried searching and cannot find the answer. So i thought to ask you.
